metadata.title: CVE-2014-8094 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the ProcDRI2GetBuffers function in the DRI2 extensionin X.Org Server (aka xserver and xorg-server) 1.7.0 through 1.16.x before1.16.3 allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service(crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted request, whichtriggers an out-of-bounds read or write.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8094` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.4
xdmx-tools - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.4
xnest - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.4
xorg-server-source - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.4
xserver-common - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.4
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.4
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.4
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.4
xvfb - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.4').
